title: M&S Shoppers Love 'Classy' Belted Trench Coat That'S Ideal For Spring
summary: M&S shoppers are raving about a new trench coat, giving it a high rating of 4.7 stars. The coat is available in light sand and black, and is versatile for different outfits. Some shoppers have criticized the pockets, but overall, it is a popular item. The article also mentions affordable trench coats from Nobody's Child and Tu Clothing.

title: One Of Only London Borough'S Where Garden Waste Is Collected For Free Every Week Plans To Charge £70
summary: Hillingdon Council plans to charge £70 for garden waste collection, aiming to save £2.5 million. This move is met with objections from residents and Labour Leader Councillor Peter Curling, who believes the figure is 'plucked out of the air'. The council is 'at risk' of bankruptcy, and the report states that low fees and charges contribute to financial challenges. The consultation is open until March 31.

title: Next Shoppers Swoon Over 'Very Pretty' Spring-Ready Cherry Print Cardigan That 'Gets Compliments'
summary: Next's Pink Red Cherry Graphic Knitted Cardigan is popular among shoppers in Tower Hamlets for its design and quality. The cardigan, priced at £43, is made from an acrylic wool blend and features a cherry print. It is available in sizes XS to 2XL and can be worn for both casual and formal occasions. However, it may not be suitable for those who prefer a more fitted silhouette. Other strawberry and cherry cardigans are also available from Mint Velvet, ASOS, and River Island.

title: Field Could Miss Rest Of Season With Ankle Injury
summary: QPR midfielder Sam Field could miss the rest of the season due to an ankle injury, which may impact the team's performance in the remaining games of the season. Field has been a consistent presence in QPR's midfield this season.

title: My 'Incel' Attackers Keep An Online Tally Of Their Victims
summary: A woman from Tower Hamlets was sexually assaulted in Vietnam by two men who identified as 'incels'. The men had a history of violence against women and kept a tally of their attacks on social media. The woman struggled to return to her normal life after the attack and wants to raise awareness about male violence towards women.

title: 'I'Ve Finally Spoken To My Mum After Seven Years'
summary: Aziz Isa Elkun, a Uyghur Muslim from Tower Hamlets, has been able to speak with his mother for the first time in seven years after she was released from a Chinese camp. Aziz is calling on the government to allow his 82-year-old mother to come to the UK, where he can care for her. The Chinese Embassy did not respond to a request for comment. Aziz is not alone, as many Uyghur Muslims in London have several family members in the camps. The Home Office declined to comment on individual cases, but said that there is not an automatic right for British citizens to bring their extended family members to the United Kingdom. Aziz is urging the British government to give his mother a passport so he can unite with her and look after her.

title: Fly-Tipping Site To Cost £350,000 To Clear
summary: Harrow Council will spend £348,000 to remove industrial waste fly-tipped on a former driving school site, causing concerns over contamination and hazardous materials. The site is set for development into 149 new homes. The opposition party accused the authority of not securing the site, but the Conservative leadership said there was a limit to what it could do.

title: More Met Staff To Strike In Flexible Working Row
summary: Metropolitan Police civilian staff in Tower Hamlets plan to strike over a dispute about flexible working, with the union arguing that staff can work efficiently from home. The strike may impact some services, but front-line roles will not be affected.

title: Images Show Future Of Square Mile Skyline
summary: New images show the future skyline of the City of London with planned new buildings, including 99 Bishopsgate and One Undershaft. The City of London Corporation is promoting the area to global investors and developers to drive economic growth and provide jobs.

title: Attempted Murder Arrest After Plymouth Acid Attack
summary: A man from Tower Hamlets was arrested for an acid attack in Plymouth, Devon, leaving a man in his 30s in serious condition.

title: Ten People Ill After Taking Heroin,  Police Say
summary: Ten people fell ill in Camden after taking heroin, six were hospitalized. No arrests have been made and inquiries are ongoing. The Met issued a warning against buying and consuming illegal drugs.

title: Boy, 16, Dies After Shooting By South London Tube
summary: A 16-year-old boy has died after being shot near Stockwell Tube station in Lambeth, London. The incident has caused huge distress to the local community and is the third homicide in the capital of someone aged under 25 this year. No arrests have been made.

title: The 1 'Grotty' Thing Londoners Remember About The Underground In The 1990S
summary: An old photo of the London Underground in 1992 has sparked nostalgia among Reddit users, who appreciated the tube's "grotty aesthetic" and distinctive smell. The post, shared on the Central Line at Bank station, received numerous comments from Londoners reminiscing about the tube's unique features, such as stains on the seats, dangly handle things, and wooden escalators. The makeover of the station aimed to make it more accessible for disabled passengers and bid farewell to Cadbury's vending machines in 2007.

title: Warning For Apple Iphone Users Over ‘Dangerous’ Charger Scam
summary: Apple has issued a warning about counterfeit iPhone chargers that are being filled with metal weights to appear authentic. These weights can compromise the electrical separation within the charger, posing a risk of electric shock or fire. Out of 22 samples tested, 68% were found to contain metal weights. Apple recommends buying directly from Apple or an Apple authorized distributor to ensure a genuine product.

title: Coronation Street Star’S Real Life Family Link To Itv’S Ruth Ellis Drama He’S Starring In
summary: Nigel Havers, an actor from Coronation Street, is starring in ITV's new series, A Cruel Love: The Ruth Ellis Story. Havers plays Cecil Havers, his real-life grandfather who was the judge in the famously controversial Ruth Ellis trial in 1955. Cecil Havers tried to make Ruth Ellis say that her lover's cruelty led her to shoot him, but she refused. Havers' grandfather wrote to the Home Secretary recommending Ruth to be pardoned, but it was refused. The series uncovers Ruth's murder of her lover using parallel timelines to explain what drove the young woman to kill.

title: City Of London Expects To Lose £27M Due To Planned Changes In Business Rates
summary: The City of London is expecting to lose £27M due to changes in business rates retention from 2026, which may necessitate a strategic and urgent response. The council is urging the government to consider a transition period and has endorsed a new investment strategy to diversify investment property. The council is also proposing a 4.99% increase in council tax and a 4p hike on the business rate premium to bolster children's services, homelessness services, and cover rising costs associated with policing.

title: Westfield Shoppers 'Narrowly Avoid Injury' As Heavy Seats Thrown Over Balcony
summary: A 14-year-old and 16-year-old were arrested after a seat was thrown from a balcony at Westfield Stratford shopping center, narrowly missing people. MP Uma Kumaran called the incident "shocking and distressing" and requested increased police patrols.

summary: A 12-year-old boy has been rushed to hospital following a stabbing at a school in North London. Police raced to the scene after receiving reports of a fight at a school on Adelaide Road in Swiss Cotta...

summary: Hundreds of new homes could be built on the site of a former pub in South London, where David Bowie first performed as his iconic Ziggy Stardust persona. The Toby Jug, in Tolworth, was one of the capi...

title: Jermaine Jenas' Wife Ellie Penfold Announces Split In Statement She 'Never Imagined' Sharing
summary: Jermaine Jenas and his wife Ellie Penfold, a model, have split up after 16 years together and 4 children. The announcement comes just months after Jenas was removed from the BBC presenting team due to complaints about workplace conduct. Jenas has since apologized and returned to broadcasting on TalkSport radio.

title: First Photos Of Clapham Shooting After Boy, 16, Shot Dead In Street
summary: A 16-year-old boy was shot dead in the street in Clapham, Lambeth, causing shock and grief in the local community.

title: Car Smashes Through Railings And Hedge To End Up Submerged In Clapton Pond
summary: A car crashed into Clapton Pond in Hackney, causing damage to the railings and hedges before becoming partly submerged. The car has been removed, but the pond remains closed for safety measures.

title: Rotherhithe Man Charged Over Murder Of London Man Found Dead In Norwich Flat With Chest Stab Wound
summary: A man from Rotherhithe, Southwark has been charged with murder of a London teenager whose body was found in Norwich with a chest stab wound. Four people have been charged with the murder, including a man from Bermondsey. The victim's mother described the family's devastation.

title: Bbc Eastenders Fans 'Floored' After Realising Stacey Slater Has 'Two Secret Siblings'
summary: EastEnders fans discovered that Stacey Slater has two half-sisters, leading to increased viewer demand. Stacey is currently grieving the loss of her partner, Martin Fowler. She has a history in Walford, having moved there in 2004. She has two known half-siblings, Sean and Kyle Slater. Fans are urging the show creators to introduce her two unrevealed half-sisters, Siobhan and Shannon Slater.

title: 350 Staff To Strike Over Being Told To Return To Office - Met Police Outline 'Contingency Plans'
summary: Hundreds of civilian staff at the Metropolitan Police, including those from Tower Hamlets, are set to strike over a dispute regarding flexible working. The strike will take place from March 17 to 28, with union members expressing concerns over the need to return to the office for non-public facing roles. The Met Police has stated that it will have contingency plans in place for public services.

title: Mum Of Child At North London School Where Boy Stabbed 'Worried For Daughter'S Safety'
summary: A mother expressed worry for her daughter's safety after a 12-year-old boy was stabbed at UCL Academy in Camden. Two 14-year-old boys were arrested in connection with the incident. The school was closed early and parents were informed via email.

title: Enforcement Notice On South London Tower Block Where Residents Fear 'Lives Are At Risk'
summary: A fire safety enforcement notice has been issued for a tower block in Thamesmead, Greenwich due to several breaches of fire safety protocols. Residents have previously raised concerns about the safety of external panelling on blocks in the estate. The notice states several issues including failure to ensure adequate fire separation between floors and no effective management of protective measures for the building. Residents are urging for all eight buildings in the estate to be covered under the notice as they are built the same way.

title: Bbc Eastenders Fans 'Work Out' Identity Of Tommy Moon'S Mystery Friend In Dangerous New Twist
summary: EastEnders character Tommy Moon, from Tower Hamlets, may be getting radicalized online after striking up a friendship with an unknown character. Fans speculate he could be a victim of online grooming, similar to a previous storyline. Tommy's mother, Kat Slater, is worried about his new friend and his behavior, which includes lashing out and withdrawing.
